tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。

sen.j: 六方（ろっぽう）とは歌舞伎・人形浄瑠璃・舞踊の演技動作。
sen.e: Roppo is an acting performance in Kabuki, Ningyo joruri (traditional Japanese puppet theater), and dance.
Roppo is an acting motion in Kabuki, Ningyo joruri (traditional Japanese puppet theater), and Buyo dance (classical Japanese dance).
Roppo is an acting motion in Kabuki, Ningyo joruri (traditional Japanese puppet theater), and Buyo dance (classical Japanese dance).
Roppo (六方) is also described in different Chinese characters (六法).
Roppo (六方) is also written in different Chinese characters (六法).
Roppo (六方) is also written in different Chinese characters (六法).

sen.j: 伊達、勇壮などを誇張・美化した荒事的動作。
sen.e: It is a rough performance exaggerated and beautified dandyism, gallantry, and others.
It is a rough motion which exaggerates and beautifies the dandyism, gallantry, and so on.
sen.cmt: performance→motion, exaggerated→exaggerates,beautified→beautifies,others→so on と修正し、which,the を挿入しました。
sen.e: It is a rough motion which exaggerates and beautifies the dandyism, gallantry, and so on.

sen.j: 歌舞伎では、当初は舞台への登場時に使われたが、現在では花道への引っ込みの場合に行われる。
sen.e: In Kabuki, Roppo was initially used when entering the stage, but nowadays used only when withdrawing into the passage through audience to stage.
In Kabuki, Roppo was initially used when actors are entering the stage, but today, it is used when they are leaving by the passage through audience to stage.
sen.cmt: actors are を補いました。nowadays→today, it is,only を削除し、withdrawing into→they are leaving by と修正しました。
sen.e: In Kabuki, Roppo was initially used when actors are entering the stage, but today, it is used when they are leaving by the passage through audience to stage.

sen.j: 『勧進帳』の弁慶の飛び六方（とびろっぽう）や、片手六方、両手六方、狐六方、丹前六方、傾城六方など様々な種類がある。
sen.e: There are many kinds such as Tobi roppo (flying exit) by Benkei in "Kanjincho" (a Kabuki story), Katate (one hand) roppo, Ryote (both hands) roppo, Kitsune (fox) roppo, Tanzen (swaggering) roppo, and Keisei (courtesan exit) roppo.

There are many kinds such as Tobi roppo (flying exit) by Benkei in "Kanjincho" (a Kabuki play), Katate (one hand) roppo, Ryote (two hands) roppo, Kitsune (fox) roppo, Tanzen roppo (swaggering walk), and Keisei roppo (courtesan exit).
sen.cmt: story→play,「丹前六方」、「傾城六方」のカッコ部分を修正しました。また、「両手六法」は用語集にて「定訳不明」となっていましたが、ウェブ上で"two hands"と確認しました。
